meanings.definition: To cause great trouble or suffering to.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site will tribulate the residents.
meanings.sent2: The ongoing pandemic continues to tribulate many families around the world.
meanings.sent3: Trying to cook a new recipe without a recipe book can tribulate even the most experienced chefs.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected storm tribulated the calm waters of the lake, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The loss of her beloved pet tribulated her heart, leaving her in deep sorrow.

meanings.definition: To be afflicted with great suffering.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he began to tribulate with physical pain.
meanings.sent2: The refugees tribulated through harsh conditions to find safety.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician managed to tribulate his own magic show, much to the audience's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her heart tribulated with conflicting emotions as she tried to make a difficult decision.
meanings.sent5: The old tree tribulated under the weight of the heavy snow, its branches bending low.
